title: Appeal
context: §664-36 Appeal. Any party aggrieved by the judgment of the court may appeal therefrom to the intermediate appellate court, subject to chapter 602, in the manner and within the time provided for civil appeals from the circuit courts. [L 1886, c 69, §6; am L 1888, c 26, §6; am L 1907, c 56, §6; RL 1925, §2941; RL 1935, §3682; am L 1939, c 19, §4; RL 1945, §10223; RL 1955, §234-35; HRS §664-36; am L 1972, c 90, §6(q); am L 2004, c 202, §77; am L 2006, c 94, §1; am L 2010, c 109, §1] Case Notes Findings may not be set aside unless clearly erroneous, HRCP rule 52(a) being applicable. 54 H. 174, 504 P.2d 1330 (1973). Cases prior to adoption of the Hawaii Rules of Civil Procedure. Court authorized on appeal to render such judgment as shall be just and equitable. 9 H. 651 (1895); 10 H. 174 (1895). Evidence insufficient. 10 H. 133 (1895); 10 H. 453 (1896). Record. 21 H. 173, 174 (1912). Findings, weight. 23 H. 595, 601 (1917); 24 H. 47, 53 (1917).
